verbs.description: underbury (third-person singular simple present underburies, present participle underburying, simple past and past participle underburied)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To bury beneath; bury under.
examples: When the marriage act was mooted, Keith swore that he would revenge himself upon the bishops, by taking some acres of hind for a burying-ground, and underburying them all.
